title: Plane Through Three Points Quiz
description: Test your understanding of plane equations through three points.

questions.question: To find a plane through three points, you need to:
options: Find two direction vectors and take their cross product
Take the dot product of the vectors
Find the midpoint of the points
questions.explanation: Find vectors from one point to the others, then take their cross product for the normal vector.

questions.question: The determinant method gives the equation:
options: Of a line through the points
Of a plane through the points
Of a sphere through the points
Of a curve through the points
questions.explanation: The determinant method gives the equation of the plane containing the three points.

questions.question: If three points are collinear, then:
options: There is no plane through them
questions.explanation: Collinear points lie on infinitely many planes (any plane containing the line).

questions.question: The normal vector from three points A, B, C is:
questions.explanation: Normal vector = (B - A) × (C - A), the cross product of vectors from A to B and A to C.

questions.question: Three non-collinear points determine:
questions.explanation: Three non-collinear points determine exactly one unique plane.
